body_html:
I couldn't find documentation on where to specify those arguments (certainly not to Python, and I could find no such ConfigProto flags). However, I did try setting intra_op_parallelism_threads to 1, and the same issue occurred. I'll try seeing if GDB can shed some light on the matter.

>>> sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(
...     intra_op_parallelism_threads=1))          
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/local_device.cc:40] Local device intra op parallelism threads: 1
[...indefinite hang...]

body:
I couldn't find documentation on where to specify those arguments (certainly not to Python, and I could find no such ConfigProto flags). However, I did try setting intra_op_parallelism_threads to 1, and the same issue occurred. I'll try seeing if GDB can shed some light on the matter.

```
>>> sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(
...     intra_op_parallelism_threads=1))          
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/local_device.cc:40] Local device intra op parallelism threads: 1
[...indefinite hang...]
```
